heading: riaa, diamond sweep away suit
subheading: the recording industry makes peace with the mp3 maker, but questions over a new standard raises a new question: will it last? by chris oakes.
author: chris oakes
text: the remnants of an early landmark legal battle between the old-guard recording industry and the new vanguard of music distribution were swept under the rug wednesday, collapsing under the weight of its present-day irrelevance. diamond multimedia and the recording industry association of america said they have resolved the remainder of their disputes stemming from a lawsuit that had labeled diamond's rio, a portable internet music player, a music copying device.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coverage
